q: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
h:
“You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.” —
Denis Waitley

q: It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.
h:
“It does not matter how slowly you go so long as you do not stop.” —
Confucius

q: Fishing is much more than fish.
h:
“Fishing is much more than fish.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: If you pray for rain, be prepared to deal with some mud.
h:
“If you pray for rain, be prepared to deal with some mud.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
h:
“People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.
h:
“Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.” —
Les Brown

q: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
h:
“When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.” —
Henry Ford

q: Don't stumble over something that's behind you.
h:
“Don't stumble over something that's behind you.” —
Steve Harvey

q: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
h:
“If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
h:
“Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: When the time is gone, you can never get it back.
h:
“When the time is gone, you can never get it back.” —
Stephen King

q: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
h:
“Whoever is happy will make others happy too.” —
Anne Frank

q: Be brave enough to suck at something new.
h:
“Be brave enough to suck at something new.” —
Unknown

q: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or to get all the credit for doing it.
h:
“No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or to get all the credit for doing it.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: People are weird. When we find someone with weirdness that is compatible with ours, we team up and call it love.
h:
“People are weird. When we find someone with weirdness that is compatible with ours, we team up and call it love.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
h:
“A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.” —
Criss Jami

q: Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.
h:
“Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.” —
Bob Marley

q: The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.
h:
“The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Don't waste your energy on being angry at something that somebody did six months ago or a year ago. It's over.
h:
“Don't waste your energy on being angry at something that somebody did six months ago or a year ago. It's over.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Don't Let Yesterday Take Up Too Much Of Today.
h:
“Don't Let Yesterday Take Up Too Much Of Today.” —
Will Rogers
